industry: Biotechnology Research and Medical Equipment Manufacturing
description:
ABOUT ORGANOX:

OrganOx has been transforming organ transplantation since 2008, leveraging groundbreaking normothermic machine perfusion technology in our flagship product, the OrganOx metra®. This technology helps preserve donor livers for up to 12 hours, in efforts to reduce organ discard rates and facilitate more successful transplants. We are an innovative, fast-paced global medical device company committed to improving transplantation outcomes. As part of our ongoing expansion in North America, we seek a motivated Product Manager, Upstream to join our team.


Position Summary

OrganOx has an exciting career opportunity for a Product Manager, Upstream to be located at our North America headquarters in Madison, NJ. In this role, you will report to Global Director of Marketing and will have global responsibility for product marketing deliverables for new products from the opportunity assessment through product development and commercial launch. You will build business cases and define project scope for new products supporting our business goals by understanding our markets, customers and competitors. You will help achieve those business goals by providing voice of business and voice of customer throughout the product development process.


Listed below are the key responsibilities of the role and a brief description of some of the key tasks to be performed. This list is not totally inclusive, and the person will be expected to complete additional tasks reasonably requested by the Director of Marketing.


Major Responsibilities

Under direction from the Director of Marketing, the Product Manager, Upstream will be responsible for:

  • Primary responsibilities include product development initiatives which support our marketing strategies and initiatives, providing voice of business, voice of customer and developing customer requirements through direct engagement with our customers and commercial teams.
  • Collaborate with R&D and marketing to translate customer requirements into meaningful product features and negotiate trade-offs necessary to meet technical requirements. Completes functional phase review deliverables.
  • Design market research and intelligence strategies to drive portfolio development decisions
  • Effectively collaborate with R&D teams and leadership to drive prioritization and progress of development efforts
  • Monitors and manages business performance for assigned product portfolio including global revenue and margin analysis, market trends and drivers, and global forecasting for new products.
  • Responsible for lifecycle management including market concept, product launch readiness, product stability and end of life.
  • Develop and execute the product roadmap strategy including identification of new products, product enhancements, and end-of-life actions.
  • Identify and create opportunity assessments including in-depth business case analysis, financial modeling, and strategic prioritization for new pipeline projects in alignment with strategic plans.
  • Define global customer needs and feature requirements for future products and assist in the development of long-range product plans.
  • Develop, maintain and grow relationships with our commercial teams, key customers and key opinion leaders.
  • Partner with key thought leaders to anticipate the future market environment and unmet needs
  • Evaluate cost reduction initiatives and SKU management for product(s) and product stewardship.
  • Evaluate and recommend market opportunities for future product(s) in the portfolio.
  • Demonstrates a primary commitment to patient safety and product quality.
  • OrganOx employees are required to conduct business to the highest ethical and professional standards; comply with applicable laws and regulations, the Advamed Code of Ethics on Interactions with Healthcare Professionals, and company policies
  • Adhere to the letter and spirit of OrganOx’s Code of Conduct and all other company policies.

Skills and Experience

The Product Manager, Upstream will have:

  • Familiarity with Voice of Customer research practices such as qualitative and quantitative studies and translation user needs to product requirements.
  • 3+ years medical device industry experience in marketing, business development or sales.
  • Strong leadership in developing comprehensive business assessments, strategies, tactics, and solutions to drive business objectives.
  • Financial modeling, forecasting, planning, and analytical skills.
  • Ability to understand complex technical product information.
  • Excellent oral and written communications.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to influence and lead others often without authority.
  • Strong organization and prioritization skills with the ability to manage several projects simultaneously.
  • Ability to perform under pressure and in a dynamic environment.
  • A high degree of initiative, motivation, and accountability for results.
  • An ability to work with all levels of management including Senior Leadership.
  • Ability to travel domestically and internationally to meet with customers, attend scientific conferences and evaluate new technologies with limited advanced notice.
  • Strong computer skills in spreadsheet, presentation, and work processing software (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, etc.).
  • Ability to be solution oriented and problem solve to find optimal solution.
  • Demonstrated complex project management experience.


Qualifications


The Product Manager, Upstream will have:


Bachelor’s degree

  • 7+ years of professional experience in marketing, engineering, or healthcare
  • 3+ years upstream marketing and/or product development experience in medical device
  • Analytical, quantitative, financial modeling, and strategic thinking skills
  • Travel - up to 25% required (mostly US; some global may be required)


A job description does not imply that the duties stated are the only ones to be performed by the job holder. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instruction as requested by their manager.


WHAT WE OFFER:

At OrganOx, we value innovation, evidence, integrity, teamwork, respect, and passion. We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits, including healthcare and retirement plans. We support work-life balance and provide opportunities for ongoing professional development.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
